title: 11 best kids' Christmas jumpers that make cute festive outfits
text:
Once the preserve of embarrassing dads, Christmas jumpers are having something of a revival.

These days they’re a festive must have for everyone, including children.

In fact, some of the best designs out there are geared at youngsters.

This round up places the most importance on quality and design – original ways to be festive is always a coup when it comes to yuletide clothing – but we’ve tried to include a broad range of budgets and styles.

From traditional Fair Isle knits to contemporary slogan sweaters, we've found a jumper fit for any little star to celebrate the most wonderful time of the year in.

You can trust our independent reviews. We may earn commission from some of the retailers, but we never allow this to influence selections, which are formed from real-world testing and expert advice. This revenue helps to fund journalism across The Independent.

Batch1 it’s all good in the pud sweatshirt: £26, Batch1

A good pun is its own reward; the bright, loud offerings from Batch1 are guaranteed to raise a smile. This “it’s all good in the pud” number tickled us the most; prepare for legions of people to tell your tot “cool jumper” and ask where it’s from. We found this true to size and were pleased with the selection of colourways which include green and red as well as the more subtle black.

Buy now

Jojo Maman Bebe robin cardigan: £24, Jojo Maman Bebe

This traditional fairisle design with a robin motif shoulder is so pretty and evokes winters of yesteryear. Not only this, but it’s super soft thanks to being a cashmere blend meaning no itching or irritation for delicate skin – it’s really tactile. Our three-year-old tester kept stroking her own arms and saying “cosy” – which is a pretty good sign. Perfect for more formal occasions, and it is wintery rather than baldly Chistmassy which means it won’t look odd if it’s rocked in January.

Buy now

Ellie Ellie children’s Christmas shark jumper: £33, Ellie Ellie

Available in four different colourways, including navy and copper these jumpers for three to 11-year-olds feature everyone’s favourite deadly sea creature limbering up for Christmas. The material is soft and light, and the fit is true to size. Christmassy, but not overbearingly so. Our tester was completely obsessed and now thinks Santa is a shark.

Buy now

Rock on Ruby baubles slogan sweater: £26, Rock on Ruby

Smaller children might want something that packs a more obvious Christmas punch but older kids will appreciate how cool this is. We think this is so cool we want it for ourselves. We love the low-key varsity vibe of the slogan – which is hand drawn and hand printed – and the understated colourways. It’s soft, ethically made and lightweight while still being cosy.

Buy now

Sparks and Daughters angel wing sweatshirt: £20, Sparks and Daughters

From the front, this is a classic navy sweater. But turn it around and you’ll be treated to beautifully illustrated shining golden angel wings. We loved the feel of the inside which was soft, fleecy and warm enough to withstand any winter chill. We think this is very cool, managing to be both simple and unusual. Our tiny tester kept turning around to show off her wings; the sense of theatre this offers is charming.

Buy now

Frugi jolly knitted snowman jumper: From £30, Frugi

It’s little details like the buttons at the shoulder that speak to the quality of Frugi’s designs. It looks expensive, well-crafted and super festive. This jumper is also soft and flexible, available for new born to ten-year-olds. Frugi uses only organic materials – this is 100 percent organic cotton yarn – and supporting that can only be a good thing.

Buy now

Next Christmas sweatshirt: £10, Next

This sweater, scattered with quintessential Christmas motifs including snowmen, candy canes and snowflakes is both contemporary and traditional. Boys and girls alike will find this easy to wear – it will look awesome with a pair of jeans – and comfortable to boot.

Buy now

Natural History Museum tree rex jumper: £25, Natural History Museum

This jumper, featuring a deadly dinosaur tangled up in Christmas lights, is totally pun-tastic. Available for children aged three to 11 (as well as adults if you want to match) this is perfect for anyone with a predilection for the Jurassic. We loved the bold red and found the fit to be true to size.

Buy now

Boden knit wing cardigan: From £30, Boden

This cardigan is such a beauty with its intricate knit and powder blue hue – but the best bit is the embroidered golden wings on the back. There’s an excellent level of detail in this cardigan and given that it’s made from a mix of alpaca and merino wool – it’s fluffy, light and soft on young skin. Also, your little one can get away with wearing this long after the 12 days of Christmas.

Buy now

Transport for London Christmas jumper: £20, Transport for London

Bringing serious retro vibes to Christmas, this jumper from the shop at London Transport Museum is a must for any kid with a passion for London buses and trains. The colours pop and it manages to be chunky and substantial but soft at the same time.

Buy now

Polarn O. Pyret snowman jumper: £28, Polarn O. Pyret

Made from pure organic cotton, this jumper feels fabulously snug, while still being breathable. There’s a retro feel to it, with the ribbed neckline and cuffs. We found this jumper to be true to size – and, noted how the button-down shoulder detail made it really easy to put on and take off. Available for children aged between one and six years old.

Buy now

The verdict: Kids’ Christmas jumpers

We think the humour in Batch1’s "it's all good in the pud" sweatshirt is enough to make it victorious. What is Christmas if not a time to have some ho ho ho?

IndyBest product reviews are unbiased, independent advice you can trust. On some occasions, we earn revenue if you click the links and buy the products, but we never allow this to bias our coverage. The reviews are compiled through a mix of expert opinion and real-world testing.

description: Children need a festive wardrobe too, so get one of these kids' Christmas jumpers from Next, Boden, Natural History Museum and Jojo Maman Bebe
